intro: Monnina sylvatica, commonly known as blue mistflower, is a herbaceous perennial native to North America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, blue-violet flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs. Monnina sylvatica is adapted to a variety of soil types and is often found in open woods and along stream banks.
